name: Tyler Kresch
body:
### About Me
I am a lifelong student and entrepreneur. Technology is my passion. I am always interested in getting involved with new ventures and advising young startups. I have worked in a number of different capacities on many different software projects, as both a contractor and a stakeholder, so I understand multiple different perspectives when working on a team. I've worked for the past four years as an Independent Software Developer and New Venture Consultant.

### Software Engineering
As a **Software Architect**, **Full-stack Web developer**, and **Entrepreneur**, I find that being comfortable in a wide variety of languages, frameworks, databases, tools, paradigms, architectures, and design patterns allows me to always have (if not The Right Toolâ„¢) at least an *appropriate* tool available for the job, even when tackling a type of problem I've never before encountered. 

To that end, I make a dedicated effort to learn and use a diverse set of **tools, technologies, patterns, and paradigms**. And when a problem calls for more than one of them, even within the same category, I'm happy to oblige. Here are some of those that I use more frequently:

#### Languages and Frameworks
 * **JavaScript**: `Node`, `React`, `Flux`, `Angular`, `Backbone`
 * Elixir: `Phoenix`
 * Ruby: `Rails`, `Sinatra`
 * HTML5: `Jade`, `Handlebars`, `Emmet`
 * CSS: `SCSS`, `SASS`
 * Python

#### Databases
 * Relational and quasi-SQL DBs: `Postgres`, `MySQL`, `Cassandra`
 * Document and BigTable DBs: `MongoDB`, `CouchDB`, `HBase`
 * Cache and In-Memory DBs: `Redis`, `VoltDB`, `Couchbase`
 * Graph Databases: `Neo4j`

#### Tools
 * Build Tools: `Grunt`, `Gulp`, `Webpack`, `Browserify`
 * Utilities: `Git`, `Github`, `SublimeGit`, `GitFLow`, `NPM`, `Bower`, `Homebrew`
 * Deploy Tools: `Amazon Web Services`, `Heroku`

### Education
I was born and raised in the US and graduated from the University of California, Santa Barbara with a degree in Philosophy and Technology Management, focusing on New Venture Creation. I am self-educated, yet classically trained in Computer Science. As an early adopter of online "MOOCs," I taught myself CS and software engineering by taking online courses from universities like MIT, UC Berkeley, Stanford, and Georgia Tech, through platforms like edX, Udacity, and Coursera.

### Contact
**Email:** [tyler@kresch.me](mailto:tyler@kresch.me)

**Skype:** tyler.kresch

**LinkedIn:** <https://linkedin.com/in/tylerkresch>
